summary:
=== Purchase Information === Review Date: 2014/08/16 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Michael Nankin', 'Allan Kroeker', 'Andy Wolk', 'Allan Arkush', 'Larry Shaw', 'Omar Madha', 'Scott Stewart', 'Mairzee Almas', 'Félix Enríquez Alcalá', 'Todd Slavkin'], 'Starring': ['Grant Bowler', 'Julie Benz', 'Tony Curran']} Review Text: I really love this show. There was a lot of action in season one, and a lot more character development this season. After seeing season 1, I decided to start playing the game. I love the game tie-ins throughout the show, it makes it seem more all encompassing. Review Title: I really love this show Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/09/30 Average Rating: 2.7 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Jerry Keys'], 'Producers': ['Jerry Keys', 'Lonnie Moore', 'Trey Ore', 'Vanessa Ore'], 'Starring': ['Muse Watson', 'Vanessa Ore', 'Jeremy Carr']} Review Text: The movie itself wasn't horrific but the dialogue was laughable and unnatural. No one acted the way you really would in certain situations, especially gory/scary ones. Review Title: Mindbogglingly bad script Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2020/10/05 Average Rating: 2.9 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Michael A. Ryan'], 'Producers': ['Michael Ryan', 'Jean Battalia', 'Ashley Bracken', 'Phil Gowan', 'Nannette Jeffers', 'Ann Marie Lockamy', 'Ace Marrero', 'Manny Martinez Hernandez', 'Tyler Vaughn Penn'], 'Starring': ['Terry Maratos', 'Rachel Kylian', 'Christopher Kriesa'], 'Studio': ['High Octane']} Review Text: This movie could have been more than an hour shorter and it would have fixed a lot of the issues. Review Title: Too long, too full of itself Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2020/10/09 Average Rating: 3.2 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Albert Chi'], 'Producers': ['Mollye Asher', 'Deanna Barillari', 'Kat Barnette', 'Jordana Mollick', 'Sara Murphy', 'Erin Pfaeffle', 'Eileen Shields', 'Kevin Shields', 'Annette Stevens'], 'Starring': ['Melora Walters', 'Jeffrey DeMunn', 'Christopher Denham'], 'Studio': ['ITN Movies']} Review Text: I felt like this was a very good scrutiny of white/rich privilege.

It was in your face- the bodies of people of color and the poor are used to supplement the rich white people who can afford such things.

A lot of people are taking the wrong message away from this, as in 'what the protagonist is doing is okay' and it is obviously not, which is why the movie is set up as a horror, and not a feel good film.

It shows that when people have money and power, they will act in a corrupt and inhumane fashion to save themselves and the ones that are closest to them.

It hit the point home very well.

The only place where it really lost me is that the main protagonist (our stand-in of course) was shown to not know what was going on, and the only other relatable character in the home seemed to know but didn't talk to her about it openly. The people in the home were awful. It would have been a lot more realistic if all of the other 'villians' who knowingly take others body parts were nice and friendly all the time, because that is how real racists and people in power act until they are behind closed doors, though I guess you could say the community was a giant closed door. Review Title: Not subtle but not on the nose either. Rating: 4.0 --------------------------------------------------

Review Title: Not subtle but not on the nose either. Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- Structure your response as: SUMMARY: [Final synthesis of preferences and patterns]
raw_response:
SUMMARY:  
This individual demonstrates a preference for engaging narratives with strong character development, as evidenced by their high rating for a series that effectively ties in with a game. They present a keen interest in action-oriented content, but their enthusiasm wanes significantly for productions with poor dialogue and execution, as shown by low ratings for movies criticized for unrealistic scripting and pacing issues. Consistent dissatisfaction with quality indicators such as script quality and character authenticity suggest a strong value placed on immersive storytelling. The presence of heavy themes, including critiques of societal issues, resonates positively when conveyed effectively, as highlighted by a balanced review of a thought-provoking horror film. Price sensitivity isn't explicitly evident, but the ratings reflect a discerning taste for quality over quantity, prioritizing well-crafted experiences over low-budget productions. Overall, their core preferences lean towards serious, well-constructed narratives that engage critically with themes, coupled with a high expectation for dialogue and pacing.

target_interaction.title: Overall gave a 9th Gate feel
target_interaction.text:
If you don't like slow burners, don't watch this. It's not a horror/edge of your seat film.

(spoiler)

The portrayal of the parents, parents' friends and of course the sister push you to try to care about the Juliet, but it's very hard to when she is being selfish throughout the movie. It's also somewhat true to life, when you have situations like this where parents and teachers put a ton of undue stress on students. Unfortunately, we didn't really get to watch Juliet grow as a 'good' person, just more toward getting what she wants, but that's what happens when you make deals with the devil.

I appreciated the way they implied that the protagonist slowly gives herself over to the devil and kills her former self. It's a pretty interesting ending.

It reminded me of the 9th Gate movie, which is a good thing.
